page.title: 16Wild Life in the Well Area
page.content: Well has a very favourable micro- climate,being in the fold of land protected from winds, with light rainfall,little mist fog or snow and clean air. The land is well husbanded with dry stone walls or hedges between fields.Hedges are mainly hawthorn with holly,hazel,elder sloe with wild rose and honeysuckle.Trees such as Ash,Oak, Wych Elm, Sycamore.There are several wooded areas, including 'the belt', 6kms long and some 20ms wide, planted as an estate boundary to Thorp Perrow. The wooded side of Holly Hill is a picture in the Spring with a profusion of primroses, violets,blue and white anemones, wood sorrel and king-cups by the stream. There is a great variety of birds,both resident & migrant,including a kingfisher & heron.Rabbits abound and there are hares,hedgehogs,foxes,mice.
